intro: Xystrolobos yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan xystrolobos, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are compound, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
